alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Grayson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 1:59PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Surry, southwestern Carroll and southeastern Grayson Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 159 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cumberland Knob, or 7 miles east of Ennice, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Airy... Flat Rock... Fancy Gap... Cana... Bottom... Low Gap... and Pipers Gap. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
